review: I had a bacon cheeseburger it was pretty good. My waitress was nice to me and their honey mustard is good which is important to me. Boneless wings were also good and the bottomless fries are a great deal.

Never been here before. I didn't realize it was a sit down restaurant. I brought my nephew here for lunch on a Saturday. No wait and the place is big!  I loved the bottles  with lights on the ceiling. I want that! We got the guac and chips, no jalapeño. The menu said "now with more guacamole." Hmmm. It was a rather small portion but it was very tasty.  An over abundance of chips for that size guac. The kid ordered a double bacon cheeseburger which comes with never ending fries. I ordered the fish and chips which came with four good sized fried golden pieces of fish. It was really good! He also got a milkshake and I got an iced tea. A little over $40, kind of expensive for lunch but the restaurant was nice, service was friendly and quick and the food was decent!

We all loved are food but the bill was pricey for what it is. Gotta get the onion ring tower. Burgers were excellent, but not a fan of their fries. The fries are bottomless but I didn't want the first batch.
Always a fan of the burgers at Red Robin.  This location is pretty much the same as any other, except I thought the service was a bit slow.

I tried the black and blue burger for the first time. Well cooked, packed with flavor in every bite. But the prickly pear lemonade took my favorite spot by far! We enjoyed a bunch of different appetizers from like endless onion rings and  garlic french fries to the artichoke dip and Mexican nachos. We were celebrating my sister's 25th birthday. The Red Robin staff surprised her singing happy birthday with ice cream. All I n all great service and a good time had by everyone. I also want to mention that our waitress gave us time to enjoy each dish without feeling rushed which also added to the experience.

Pros: happy they had a Boca vegan burger, fiery ghost burger and voodoo fries were actually hot. Service was great Cons: my burger had cheese enough I said no cheese AND I mentioned that I was allergic. They didn't even make me a new burger. Also the fried themselves were over salted and grossly overcooked.  Would not recommend but maybe I was just unlucky.

Horrible experience. Server never came back to check on us. I had to tell another server to call our server. Then superviser arrived and told us what we need. I told her that we would like some fries but fries never came. I called our server from tablet on our table but never arrived. Really bad service. Was not even busy. Half of the tables were empty. I do not recommend this spot.

Great atmosphere. I always have my favorite Cod Burger and delicious fries.unfortunately...  You have to wait to be seated at least 20 min even on weekdays which is really annoying if you are starving.It is also possible to wait 30 min for extra stuff you asking after your order.The service is too slow... .

While it wasn't the greatest culinary experience of my life, it was pretty good. My wife and I stopped in yesterday for lunch. We were seated promptly by a friendly hostess. Our waitress arrived quickly to take our drink orders. A pint of Porter for me and an I've water with lemon for herself. Somebody had to drive. I thought that $ 7.59 was a bit much for a pint but oh well. My better half ordered a grilled cheese and I went with the French Dip. To be honest.none of the burgers appealed to me. Both meals were good but my fries could have been hotter. Lunch for 2 came to $31.61. We will return

I am a huge fan of Red Robin. I have been coming here for years. The whisk river burger and the banzai are my favorites. Can't come here without getting the tower of onion rings. The bottomless steak fries are awesome. The kids love it and the staff is friendly and they always go above and beyond. I'm a loyal Red Robin person!

Ashley has amazing customer service! Out of all the times I've come here she's helped me twice and always has great suggestions and patience for someone like me who is picky AF! Her drinks are just as amazing as her! My go to from now on!

Red Robin is in general my "entry level" for burger restaurants, particularly when my mom is with me. She prefers turkey burgers, which they do well. She also has some dietary restrictions, which they can accommodate. I'm not keen on their fries, but I'm glad they now let you substitute things like salad or broccoli or cole slaw. I also like their sweet potato fries better then their regular fries; I just wish you got more with your order. Mom's turkey burger was fine. My cheeseburger came out cooked to order, but the beef did not have a particularly strong flavor. The majority of the flavor was the smoky sauce on the bottom bun. It was good, but I'd rather have the taste of the burger. The little monitor machines they have at the tables here are a 2-edged sword. I do like being able to pay by credit card on them.  But what I don't like is that they make the wait staff less proactive, and that was certainly the case here. If you want refills on drinks or your unlimited sides, you have to use the device to request them. It's like the staff is trained not to offer them - they wait for you - and as a result they don't check on you quite as often, unless it's to see if you're done with your meal.  Our bill was also incorrect. I ordered a substitute side for my meal as well as an extra side, and I was charged for both. Our waiter did correct that when notified. Quite frankly, for the price I paid here, I'd rather spend slightly more money and get roughly the equivalent down the street at Burger 21.

Our waitress was very forgetful. We ordered multiple things and small things were forgotten. A side order and a drink. We also had a 45 minute wait just for the food. The waitress didn't check on us. Food wasn't that great. Our salads had very little toppings. Burger was very plain. Had empty condiment bottles. Had high expectations.
Great food and excellent atmosphere compared to my experience at the Saratoga location. The food tastes better and again, great atmosphere.

Poseur - noun - /pō-zr/  Merriam-Webster defines poseur as such: "A person who pretends to be what he or she is not." Red Robin Gourmet Burgers, they call themselves. Red Robin is a poseur. There is absolutely nothing gourmet about Red Robin. Red Robin is an average chain, serving typical, mediocre chain fare.  If you like a good burger there are so many better choices than Red Robin. The focus at RR is on toppings. A good burger needs few toppings. But Red Robin is all about the toppings, to the neglect of the actual "burger". The beef patties on RR's "Gourmet Burgers" are a slap in the face to great burgers everywhere. The patties are dense, chewy, and flavorless. If you like to eat toppings, by all means, go to RR, order a burger and enjoy. And be glad that the burger is hidden under a mountain of veggies, condiments and cheese. But if you like hamburgers... you know, the things with tender, flavorful, ground beef patties in them? Avoid RR.

Just your average burger joint here in Albany.  I do enjoy coming here with my family though because it is a family friendly environment.  My wife really  likes the Onion Rings and their honey mustard.  There are a lot of different options for entrees from Burgers to Salads.  Good place for a quick burger craving fix.
We loved it!! First time to Red Robin. Royal Red Robin burger and my husband got the whiskey BBQ burger!  The service was good!  The atmosphere was upbeat and casual!

Went on a Tuesday night ! Thinkin it's slow  , in and out , WRONG!!! Slow service abounds ! The waitress actually walked by our table with out even a smile , waited 15 minutes for a water ! Bad experience 2 stars

1 star. If this was based on the food we ate, most I'd give would be 2-2 and a 1/2. Fried zukini was fresh crunchy and Delish. Though the thick batter was crunchy, it had no taste or seasoning so bland. My burger was just average. I had the A1 burger. Her salad was not appealing to the eye at all, burnt garlic bread, etc. now... it was a Sunday, but that shouldn't matter. 1- we were sat immediately. After almost 20 min, a girl came by to see if we were greeted. No. We had no waters, etc. she went to the girl who was our waitress, and after another 20 min, she finally came by. We received our small app in like 20 minutes. So it's been an hour, and we basically just got water, coke, and fried zukini. We than waited almost 50 min for a salad and a medium burger. 2 hours+. I've had 4 course fine dining meals that took less time. Horrible. Manager never came and spoke to us. Really bad 1st impression and I wouldn't go back
My family and I love this place. They have the best burgers around! I just wish there was one closer. They have nicest staff. Any time we come to Albany we stop at our favorite Red Robin. Yummmmmm

Best burger joint in the area! We gladly made the 40 minute trip before a Red Robin opened closer to us. Personally? I still prefer this location. Just for the ambiance - the service and food are great at every Red Robin I've been to, from NJ and NY alike!

Very good service and the waitress was very enjoyable. She was nice and she was even able to take a picture of the family, which that was pretty awesome. The food was good, I ordered The Big Ghost, the burger came pretty quick and it's presentation was nice. If I had to nitpick, the only thing I wish it had was a little more of the ghost pepper sauce and for it to have a little more fresh peppers on it. besides that the burger was overall very delicious and tasty. You can tell the food is freshly made and it is good quality. The prices on the food was pretty decent for a gourmet burger, not cheap, and not too expensive. The atmosphere was enjoyable, it seems like quite the family place and I have to say, I definitely want to come here again the next time I am in Latham.

Service was slooooow for an empty restaurant .. Was suppose to remove an item that took forever to get.. Then it showed up again ! The manager did take care of it .. But not impressed with lack of service here.. Was 3:30 and slow.. Really?

Meh... Burgers were good, but didn't live up to the wonderfully flavorful descriptions in the menu. I had the Burning' Love Burger and couldn't taste any of the ingredients separately. Just kinda melded together, with no "wow, that's interesting" flavor.  There was no char flavor to the burger either, which I like.  Unless you have a huge appetite and no concern about calories, endless fries are ridiculous. Service was very good. Drinks, a Bombay martini for $6 and a Cocorita(?) Were very good. Will definitely go back for drinks! All said, a nice experience, but expensive... 3 burgers and fries with above drinks and a lemonade incl. tip = $69.

What a madhouse. When we stopped in today, there was a line out the door. We had to wait 30 mins for a table, and after being seated it took close to an hour to get our food. Just seemed like a ridiculously long wait for fairly average burgers. I was also disappointed with how awful the bathrooms were. Smelly, dirty, and no toilet paper anywhere.

We love their burgers but the service and cleanliness is a killer.  We sat outside. They moved dirty plates to another table to seat us. There are 6 tables that are absolutely dirty. Money still left at tables. A family with a young child is trying to sit outside and there is no room because the tables aren't bussed. Our entire meal not one person came out to clean off the tables. Another couple is being seated and they again move the dirty plates to another table. The tables are overflowing with dirty tables.  I asked and was told only one buss person. Although, the tables inside are cleaned off. The actual manager came out and did the same thing with the dirty plates to seat another family.

I'm stumped as to why this gets on "best places to take kids" lists, because it's basically a loud TGIF / Ruby Tuesday / Applebee's kind of joint, right down the the uncurated selection of random Americana on the walls. There's nothing particularly interesting for kids to do or see here (two for-pay coin op video games, big whoop), and the children's menu is decent but really standard in terms of selections. The burgers are good, as you might expect, but value for price I didn't find them that remarkable. The ballyhooed bottomless fries come with a catch: they give you very few at first, you then have to ask for a refill, and they get progressively harder to refill. So, meh, it's OK but for the price and trouble waiting (and great, great dificulty hearing -- IT IS VERY LOUD), a trip to Five Guys seems like a much better bargain. The privilege of buying an $8 beer notwithstanding.

I dont think this place even deserve one star to be honest. Extremely unprofessional and racist. To make long story short, we waited over 20, and not a single waiter came to talk to us. It wasnt particularly busy at the time with empty tables and parking spaces. We saw couple of waiters walk by but none of them even raised an eye on us. We tried signaling myltuple times and were ignored. The table on our left came 10 minutes after us was being served right after they sat down. And then it came to us; we happened to be the only Asian customer around. We will never return and won't recommend to anyone who wants to be treated fairly.

Don't get in here enough, as I have this image of a fast food chain with meh chain food.  But, Red Robin, at least these days now, is not meh.  They have great specialty burgers, seasonal selections, and great beer on tap.  Was great for monday night football last week!

I only gave it 3 stars because my good was ice cold. They fixed my food first and it sat there while the other 3 meals were being prepared. I had the macaroni and cheese and the clucks. The other 3 were burgers.  Our waitress was fabulous though. The one good thing there.  I just hate complaining  but here is another thing that bugged me. Two of us ordered the freckled lemonade.  It is supposed to be a never ending drink but the bartender was so slow I only got one I could see it if it was busy but it was really slow. If you had a soda like the other 2 at our table you got refills pronto. As I said before our waitress was awesome, but that was it.

Was asked how I wanted my burger cooked, I asked for medium rare. The server said it would be "as pink as possible." I assumed that would end up being medium well or medium, but it came out very well done. I didn't send it back, but if I end up here again and this happens, I will.  Asked for water that never came. The service is okay, but it is the tag-team type when someone different handles every step of the meal. In my experience, this results in sub par service, but I am guessing the method allows a restaurant to under staff the dining room and still get the food out.  There are tablet devices on every table. It is obnoxious. They also charge $2 for using it. If you come With kids, ask for it to be removed if you don't want to pay the "entertainment fee."

I love burgers and was excited about a causal place with a cool burger menu. I have tried Red Robin three times now over the course of two years.  Not just at this location.  Each and every time I have experienced intestinal distress afterwards.  It is like Jim Gaffigan's bit about hot pockets.  I assumed it was just me but I have talked to a number of people who have also experienced the Red Robin effect.  For this reason I have to award a one star rating and start asking the hard questions.  I don't get it, I mean it always seems packed.  Or at least they have that circular parking lot that makes it appear like people are going there to eat.  How can this be?  Do they simply not care about the red robin effect?  Do they not care because it's cheap and the kids like it?  Do they like a little pain and discomfort to remind them about their poor choices?  Who can say?  I can say this place is just plain terrible.  Bottom Line:  Reeed...Roobin.......YUCK!

I was there in a hurry and surprisingly, unlike what some had mentioned earlier, the waitress was actually quite friendly and willing to serve. I had a signature Chinese burger. Nice medium juicy burger. The fries was...meh, eatable? Below average? Unfortunately, I felt like it is slightly over priced. One star off.

With all the burger choices in the area, why anyone would choose this place is beyond me.  Over priced, poor service and loud.  One and done, I wouldn't go back there for any reason. It's a chain, I didn't expect much, but if you want an average burger, you can go to a number of places rather than this one.

Just not good.... Waiter was ok. Both our burgers were cooked wrong ( the table next to us sent theirs back for the same reason). Forgot my seasoned fries and the side of horseradish we asked for. Waitress had so much perfume on made me nauseous. With all that said the burgers are tasteless and thin.. Why would anyone go here twice

The place smells like a dirty bar and a NYC train station mixed into one! The worst smelling place in Albany. I'm surprised that they passed the health inspection because this place is gross. Will never go ever!
Great place to eat if you like the feeling of an entire salt shaker being dumped uncontrollably into your mouth.  Bring some water.

Red Robin makes a reasonably good burger and good steak fries.  There are a number of choices and toppings and it will take a while to get through the menu to decide.  The price is fair.  Went with 2 friends for lunch on a Friday afternoon and our waitress was excellent.  She was very attentive and took good care of us.  We tipped her 22% and she deserved it.  In the past I have taken my wife there because she thinks their fish and chips are very good.

This would have been a one star review, but our waiter saved them another star... When we got there they said it would be 10-15 minutes for a table so I told the hostess our name and told her we'd be at the bar.. Then all of suddenly we heard her yelling rudely towards the front door, not the bar... "Last call Ron party of 2"... When my fiancée walked up and told her we didn't hear her as we were sitting at the bar where we said we would be there was no apology... Got the night started poorly... None of the food was anything special... Very tasteless.... Every Time our appetizer or meals came out they were missing the side dipping sauces...  All of the staff seems very unhappy working there and I could see why after seeing the way I'm guess she was the manager (in white shirt) was treating the staff...  I don't think we'll be returning....

I like this place... They make good burgers... The fries are endless, onion rings have the best breading and a ton of other stuff... they are very inviting to families with children...  As far as service... Yes this place has fucked up my order a few times... But out of how many times my family and I have been there... It's no big deal... They have always been friendly and attempted to fix any wrong doing...  Weird that today our waitress said they have gone corporate and asks the customer to take an online survey for her to get more hours at work... Orwellian weird... What ever happened to a boss running a place and knowing who a good worker is and giving them the most hours... If that's true that's fucked up... Or maybe it's a lie by the waitress to get a kick back when she gets people to take the survey...  Either way that has nothing to do with the food which is always good...

Food is good, 3:5. However something was seriously wrong with the kitchen or something. We ordered and waited.. And waited... And waited.. And got our food out 40 minutes after we ordered. Food came out cold and wrong. We also ordered some bottomless garlic french fries, which only came out once. Bad experience. I like Red Robin, but not this one in particular..

A fun place to bring your kids!  But beware, they are not up front with you about the entertainment fee they will charge you. When you sit down and if your child starts playing with RR's tablet device (you know how kids get a hold of these tablets and start pressing buttons!) you will be charged $1.99 for the use of the tablet!  If you don't like it, ask them to remove it from your bill. RR needs to be up front with this information when you sit at the table with the electronic device.  Or maybe they should only bring it to your table when it is time to pay.  I've been a big fan of RR up till now.  Next time I may think twice about bringing my family there as I'm not sure what they'll try to sneak by me next.  JUST BE UP FRONT!  I honestly don't mind if my child might be entertained by an electronic device.  So if I knew I had to pay, and didn't happen to have my smartphone at the time, $1.99 wouldn't be so bad.  Now think about this....If you think about all the people (and there are many!!) who have visited RR and who haven't noticed this extra fee on their bill....from a business perspective, RR is making a lot of dough on this.  Be fair RR, be up front.

The burgers were good but the wait for food was excessive. The onion ring tower that pauly ordered was cold. Cmonnnn already. Let's get it together here. My experience was fine but you really hurt Pauly's feelings. Crazy!

We had to try the burgers since RR claims to be gourmet. Gourmet they are not. Let's talk about the meat patties, the essence of a great burger.  First, the rarest they will cook a burger is Medium. But when you order Medium it's always served fully cooked with no pink but with grisly mystery bits of who knows what in the meat and the patties are super dry and tasteless.  The are not fresh tasting despite the fact that they claim their meat is never frozen. The meat is poor quality and it scares me that they refuse to serve their burgers with even a tinge of pink. These are over priced poor quality burgers. What's funny is that they offer a black and blue burger. Traditionally black and blue means meat flash sealed/blackened on the outside with and almost raw interior. Their interpretation of a black and blue is a well done burger seasoned with Cajun spices and topped with blue cheese.  So, if you like decent burger patties cooked to your liking without being well done or with bits of gristle, don't consider this a destination burger spot.

Another great experience with red robin.  Had the A1 Peppercorn Burger and it was delicious like it usually is. Tried the mint brownie milkshake and it was pretty good. Mixed well and balanced well. Service was good. No complaints there.  The o my real complaint I would have is the price is a little steep but could be worse and could be better. The fries are bottomless and a good thing too. I got about 8-9 of them I. My plate with the burger.  But still good and great service.

Was told by the server that the BOCA original vegan burger is not vegan (I have a severe milk allergy and I was told it has cheese). The server (Brian) was rude and short when questioned about it. He even walked away before I tried to order something else. I was with a large group (30 people) and it was overwhelming but still no excuse we had three servers.  Other than that the food was great and we did not have to wait to long for the food.

When the hostess asked me if my wife and i would mind a 2 person booth and i responded no she was visibly p.o.'ed. The food was ok but the fries came out cold. The manager did come by and ask how everything was and he graciously replaced them with fresh fries. Overall I'm disappointed and most likely won't be back for a very long time. For that price i have lots of options available where customer service starts at the front door.

They were pleasant on the phone and when I picked up my order.  The 79 cent up charge for sweet potato fries was totally worth it; they were pretty good.  The chicken was rubbery and had lots of hard little fat bits.  The tomatoes were waxy tasting.  And there were crumbs in the mayo.  Nothing is more off putting that crumbs of unknown origin in take-out mayo.  I know it is a burger place and I got chicken, but if you're going to offer it on the menu it should be better than it was, but then again maybe it is my fault for not getting a burger ;-) It is a chain so I shouldn't have expected much more.

The I.D. I was carrying was expired, that was on me.  The snark I received from the bartender when I made a joke of my heightened age to my friend, well that was on her. Oh, I must've gotten under her skin indeed, cause she put my order on my friend's bill, disappeared when I asked it to be separated, and then made several drink orders (which sat unclaimed on the bar for 5 minutes) before cashing me out.  I was so upset that I almost didn't spend $7 on the 8 ounce spinach artichoke dip. The dip!  Watered down (hopefully not by spit).  Was not served with the advertised celery.  WAS served with a bonus not listed item: onions.  I HATE onions, as in I wouldn't have ordered it if I had known. Ordering the dip was like asking out a girl only to find out that she has more hair on her chest than I have on my head.  But I would've still gone on a date with her instead of spending another evening here.

We typically love Red Robin. Stopped in on our way back to PA. Mid afternoon and not really busy. We waited forever for our food and our waiter acted like we were bothering him when we asked for things like silverware, a refill on water and fries. I could understand if they were busy but when the place isn't busy I don't think 1 refill of fries and 1 refill on drinks is to much to ask. Also sandwiches tasted different from other RR restaurants

Found a wad of long black hair in my daughters Mac n cheese the gm came to our table and said no one in the kitchen has long black hair and insinuating it was not there fault which was insulting.  My daughter then ate a few fries cause she was still hungry and pulled out a brown larva looking thing from her mouth, the other end stuck in the fry. Gm told us it was an apple seed they use the same board to cut there fries. I asked the waitress if there fries came in a bag which was obvious they did verse hand cut. She confirmed they came out of a bag.  The gm was rude and said he took my daughters food off the bill which wasn't the point the point was he lied and made us feel like we were after free food.

For a chain restaurant the burgers are pretty damn consistently good. My problem is the service... which I think results from the kitchen not having enough workers. If you want good service here sit at the bar or the tables around the bar. The bartenders are the best servers.  A few times we have been here our orders have been messed up. Managers fixed without prompting which is nice. It's a chain restaurant... but better than most. LOVE the fries.

Absolutely horrendous service and food at the Latham location.  The fries came out cold, the burger was wrong because they were "out of onions" and the waitress had a bad attitude.  So much for the customer being right. Needless to say we will not be returning after that experience.  I might go to to the one in Clifton Park but Latham is out for good.
Hmmm based on past reviews it seems strange for a 5star but it is what it is. For us one of the better burger places,service always good,we always enjoy our visits to this restaurant
Great food.  Alright service.  Perfect night out.  It definitely met all expectations for a chain restaurant.

Greeted in less than friendly manner and had to wait 25 minutes. Once seated our waitress Kelsey was super nice. She took our order promptly & got us our drinks & some chips right away. Food was delicious & well proportioned. We all has different burgers and thought they all tasted great. Kelsey refilled our drinks without us ever asking! Overall a super experience! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting a good quick delicious meal.

Tonight the food was very good. I tried the purple lemonade tonight and it was delicious. Its got prickly pear in it. Our waitress on the other hand was extremely inattentive. We asked for silverware twice our drinks and our check twice after waiting about 15 minutes between.
I come here at least once a month and get the same thing. Whiskey river BBQ burger! Love onion straws

I had Catherine as a waitress felt like she was over worked and fed up but she was trying to push thru the night shift great work and let her know it. Red Robin get some more staff on for that you lose a star. Food was amazing though no complaints there!

It started off meh when I got the kids menu (to color during the wait lol) and they brought out a depressing black and white copy of the kids menu. I always have had a great experience here and this was like all the rest. Great food out server was awesome but my only complaint is the prices are a little up there but you get what you pay for I guess :)
I don't understand why this place is so underrated!! When my brother visits from the city, we always go to RR! So awesome.

Usually my wife and I go to somewhat upscale restaurants, but last nite we wanted burgers. While we always stay away from,"Crap, Go kill yourself, awful places like McDonalds, Burger King, 5 Guys, Wendy's, and others, we went to Red Robin years ago and we remembered that is was pretty good. Well, we were right.  You have to understand that a restaurant like Red Robin is what it is. A burger joint that does it correctly. I got a pepper smoke burger with fries and my wife got a guacamole and bacon burger with fries.We both also had premium cocktails.From start to finish the burgers were fantastic(NOT GREASY). The fries were thick and flavorful, and the service was great. Our waiter, Carter, was very pleasant and was on the ball. At a burger joint, this is as good as it gets. Before winter is over, I'm pretty sure we will be back. Ya gotta try this place.

This is not somewhere I would choose to eat again and again.  But I am married, and marriage means compromise.  So, every few months or so I am dragged to Red Robin.  And I keep my mouth (mostly) shut, so that the next time we go out to eat, I can drag him somewhere I prefer (read: better).   Now, don't get me wrong, the food here often tastes decent.  How could it not with all that fat content?  I personally prefer to consume food that tastes good due to its quality ingredients, flavor combinations and preparation.  But maybe that's just me.   Red Robin is basically fast food served to you by a waitress, with additional options for your meal, plus beer and cocktails.  They have balloons for the kiddies and the occasional appearance of a person dressed in a creepy mascot-type robin outfit.  (Although I would argue it isn't a robin at all, because it's entire body is red rather than just its chest.  But I digress.)  Unlike many other reviewers here, I've found the staff to always be very friendly and moderately attentive.  Red Robin is of course known for their burgers.  Calling them 'gourmet' is a stretch, though.  While some of them are tasty, they are served to you half wrapped in a paper sleeve to prevent all the fatty contents from spilling out the back when you take a bite.  As a result, all the juicy fattiness accumulates in the sleeve and is soaked up by your bun, thereby saturating the last half or third of the burger by the time you get to it and rendering it inedible.  Blech!  Maybe this is a blessing in disguise, though, because the effect on my stomach from eating just half the burger is pretty unfortunate, so I can only imagine the consequences if I ate the whole thing.   I've tried the salads, which I found to be less disappointing than the burgers.  They are also loaded up with fattiness, so after learning to ask for dressing on the side, I've also become accustomed to eating around the huge globs of cheese.  Perhaps I should move to the wrap / chicken sandwich sections of the menu.  Something here has to be good... Right??
The burgers and fries were really good but the restaurant smelled bad. Like mildew or mold?

Called to place an order for pick-up and 17 minutes on hold should have been the warning. After placing the order I was given an estimated time of 45 minutes to go pick it up. I showed up 30 minutes after (just in case) and my food was already out so I was excited. when I get home I find that the entire order was cold. The chicken wings were not even warm, cold as if you just taken them out of the fridge, I had to warm the entire food in the microwave. I had also ordered 2 burgers, chili, and 3 desserts. I only got 2 desserts and was charged for 3 burgers. I called the restaurant as soon as I got home and spoke with the manager Mike and he assured me he will give me the money back for a burger that I didn't get and my 3rd dessert. He even got my Credit card # to do so. waited a few days and I didn't see any credit, so I called again and left a message to call me back....it's been a month and still waiting! Terrible customer service, love the food when is warm.

My husband and I like to take our toddler here. We really like their burgers. You can order any of their burgers protein style. Their ranch dressing is delish. We never had a bad experience coming here.

Been several times and usually a wait which is not there fault but I truely feel food is overpriced for what you get. Also last time we went it was busy so waited for a waiter to take our order and getting our food we understand but when we wanted a refill on the fries were told they have no more fries how can a Restraunt run out of fries.  LOL  Overall staff was friendly and place was clean but from now on if I see customer s waiting outside well pass on by.

They do an all around good job. I went there last night with the girlfriend, we were seated quickly served quickly, one minor mixup with one of the items was rectified immediately and politely. The waitress checked in often enough but not to the point of being annoying. Definitely would recommend the Latham Red Robin.

Went between lunch and dinner so it was pretty empty. Ordered the bacon cheeseburger w/ onion rings. Meat was just the way I wanted it. and the onion rings were the best I've ever had, hands down!!! The service was top notch!(never even had to ask for a soda refill. It was there before I was done) this was my second time at this location and I have had nothing but a positive experience!!!!

I am a fan! Service is prompt and courteous, even when busy (which is often, they are so popular).  My favorite is the burnin love burger but with a garden burger. Just awesome. I eat here more than I should, honestly.  Have tried other menu items (huge salads, good chicken sandwiches, other burgers with meat) but my heart belongs to the burnin love burger. My kids love it here too.

We love RR for the care it gives to those, like us, who need to order from the allergy menu. Tonight, we had to ask to make sure the gluten-free bun was actually gluten-free - it is a significant improvement over the previous version. We sat in the bar because it was crowded and there was no wait for a high top table there, but that didn't slow down the delivery of our food in any way.

First time at Red Robin.  I LOVE burgers, so when I heard about Red Robin, I was excited.  I've been meaning to go, and I finally made it. I am in 100% agreement with Daniel B. that Five Guys is the #1 place in the area for a burger.  Ever get a Five Guys bacon cheeseburger (only wimps get the "little burger" with one paltry patty) with Everything on it?  It's the one of *the* best burgers for a chain, if not the best! However, the point goes to Red Robin for choices.  Many creative types of burgers.  I had the Royal, and it was very good.  Sooo many options!  They all sound so good. Ah, but the steak fries suck.  They can make it bottomless all they want, but it's pretty mediocre.  Compare that to Five Guys fries, it's not even close. Whoa, but wait!  Ice cream root beer floats are also bottomless!  Point goes to RR. Overall, not a bad place for a family outing.  Cute decor, a balloon for my daughter, and a larger menu makes for a good chain experience, and the burger is good enough compromise so that the rest of my family can have something else.  That's something Five Guys cannot provide.

Meh service. The one in poughkeepsie is way better.  The food itself wasn't bad, but our waitress seemed clueless and it was as if we were her first customers ever.  we actually visited for my SIL's birthday (free burger and ice cream sundae), and when she gave us the check, we asked about the sundae, to which she replied- "oh, you want the ice cream?"  -_-  it also took FOREVER to get our orders, refills, etc.  again, though, if service wasn't an issue, and we were just rating our food, i'd probably actually change this to 4 stars.

Your garden variety burger chain. If you're in the mood for a burger and want a step up above fast food but don't feel like making one yourself or following the grease droppings to your hidden neighborhood burger heaven. Red Robin will due. If you can tolerate the loud noises, children and average wait time, you'll have yourself plenty of burger options to choose from.

I am not one to defend a chain restaurant, but Meg H's experience sounded so bizarrely different than I recently had at the RR in Portland OR, I had to go on their website and check it out. (My stars are for the OR location.) Fact: RR's Latham menu lists 27 different burgers. Of these, Meg's "natural burger" is described as: "For those who like their burgers in the buff, we offer this scantily clad substitute. Includes lettuce, tomatoes, pickles & onions on the side. Served with guest choice of melon or fries." So, perhaps not a sybarite's obvious laser-beam pick? Fact: soft drinks are on the part of the menu called "bottomless beverages". Which to me suggests that if your glass is too small (though the one I had was the size of a small pitcher), you should ask for a refill when you're done, then repeat as indicated. BTW, diet choices include Diet® Coke™, iced tea, and Minute Maid Lite. Meg, it could be the waitress was messing with you. (Or maybe you just need a wider screen for your computer!) Anyway, I hope you'll try another visit, be firm with your preferences, and report back.

This is the 10th time but very bad experience and never going back again. What happened to our over priced but good burgers and service?. The server was in a hurry and forced us to order really fast. But didn't bring the food quickly. When it came my kid's pizza was like piece of  cardboard and our burgers were cold. I heard that corporate took over this location and I guess they messed up the service too. To add fuel to the fire, they didn't have the balloon for my kid and the lady in the front showed very cold shoulder to my kid with no sympathy to the kid who couldn't eat the cold pizza. We left and got some food for my kid across the street ( good old friend McDonald) and my wife called the place and talked to the manager. Manager was nice and asked if she could send some gift card for the place?. We said "Nope. We don't want it since we won't be coming back again for sure".

This is the first time I've eaten at a Red Robin's and I have to say it's one of my new favorite chain restaurants. Their menu is nice, a little different from other chain restaurants, great chicken sandwiches and burgers. Great friendly service. Endless fries and drinks. Their Lemonade cupcake wasn't bad either.

Awesome, delicious, juicy burgers and just-perfect bottomless steak fries. We went during the busy lunchtime, and the place seemed a little understaffed so service was a bit slow, which is largely why the four stars. Also, I got a spicy jalapeño burger which took a little away from the taste as the spice was a little overpowering. Still, delicious overall and a great clean, lively atmosphere.

Not my top choice to get a burger. I prefer the greasy little hole in the wall joints. But they do make some interesting concoctions. The food and service has improved since the last time I had gone tho. One of the better burger chains.
still solid for burgers with my family - no issues good service it is all good !

The service at this particular RR is always in poor shape. We went in for a late dinner around 8:30 on a Saturday night. We were seated quickly, always a plus, and our server greeted us immediately, a good sign. We placed our drink order, a pepsi and an "Adult Shake," with Jameson, Guinness, and chocolate ice cream, that was effing fantastic, sucked it down in 5 minutes! A little bit longer of a wait for Kristen, our server, to come back to the table to order food, I guess she was busy with her other two tables. I feel like we must have been her last one because she was always disappearing, probably to do side work or roll silverware.  After a long but not too long of a wait to place our order of 2 burgers and fries, we waited about 35 minutes for our burgers with maybe a dozen other guests in the restaurant. She dropped of our food and never came back. I had to shout to get her attention for the water I asked for at the beginning of our meal, and my husband had to  call for her attention as well to get more "unlimited fries." She must have only heard him say "me" instead of "we," because she only brought fries for him. I didn't even bother saying anything except, "Can we get the check and a box." We weren't even done with our meal, we shoveled food into our mouths, left a tip equivalent of her work, and went home.  Oh yes, and on the first snowfall of the year, you'd think they salt the parking lot? Nope, super icy and slippery.

I really like Red Robin.  This is my third one, and it still stands up to the others I've been to. I had the A-1 Peppercorn turkey burger this time and really liked how spicy it was! I always ask for a side of pickles, and they never forget them! I like the size of the burger as well as the value you get for your $$.  Our server was very sweet and on top of everything, so we never had to ask twice.  We were in and out in under 45 mins, which was also nice.

I weep for Albany.   There is a billboard on I-90 that claims, once again, the good people of Albany have voted Red Robin as the Best Burgers in the area. Even people on Yelp have said positive things about the burgers here, some while disparaging the restaurant as a whole. I was suspicious.  Nay, highly suspicious.  But figured I shouldn't judge until I tried.  Well, I did try.  And the results were even worse than I expected.  At the very least, I thought it might be a big fat greasy gut bomb of way too much meat on a light and squishy buttery bun, a la Fuddruckers. How ground beef can be dry, flavorless and chewy, I don't even want to fathom.  There was nothing good about this burger.  Nothing good at all.  The best I can say is that the toppings were all fresh, and not wilted. No points for drowning crappy meat in high-fat toppings.  Regardless of how many, or how clever the combinations.  It is also generally a bad sign when the waitress asks how you want your burger cooked, and you learn the only choices are medium, medium-well and well done. If you are going to have a brown burger... go to Five Guys.  And never, never go to Red Robin again.  Unless of course, you just want to down yourself in beer and bottomless fries.  How Five Guys did not get the vote of my newly adopted community for best burger, I will never know.  But it is a wrong, that must be corrected.

Decent burgers.(They will do medium rare). This chain caters to children and they do a good job at that. If you don't have kids and don't like the noise associated with them you might want to go elsewhere.

I've been to Red Robin twice in the last year, with the most recent time being this past weekend.  Other reviewers seem to think that the service hasn't been good, but I've actually experienced great service when I've been there. I usually get the Bleu Ribbon burger, and it doesn't disappoint.  I think it's the onion straws.  And I usually get the chipotle may on the side, because I'm a fan of dipping.  The one thing I don't really like about the place is the layout.  It seems too open for me.

I've been here several times and it's very popular on the weekends. The prices here are reasonable. My favorite meal is the California Chicken Burger (charbroiled chicken breast, jack cheese, bacon, guacamole, pickles, tomatoes, lettuce, and mayo) served with the "bottomless" steak fries and a large chocolate milkshake with a silver refill tin. Of course, I was very pleased to enjoy a couple extra rounds of the "bottomless" steak fries, which the server happily obliged. This is a great place to go out for dinner or snacks with friends.
Red Robin is what it is.  It's a sit down place that has a wide menu of pretty decent burgers & salads for a modest price.  The atmosphere is always pleasant and the service is usually good.

Went to this place for the first time in a while for lunch.  Two of my coworkers are going to India in a few days and they wanted RED MEAT one last time.  So we went to Red Robin. This is yet another cheesy chain place.  Clapping birthday waiters, lots of absolutely pointless crap on the walls, etc.  I hate places that look like a circus, but what do I know. You get burgers at this place, end of story.  I saw the menu and they had a few other items, but why bother I thought.  I ordered a patty melt, just to make sure there was absolutely nothing healthy about the meal.  Hahaha.  They give you the big steak fries with the special seasoning and sauce, and to be honest I am not much of a fry guy so I didn't really like those.  The patty melt however was fabulous.  I mean, it tasted really good.  The cheese and onions were fantastic, the burger dripping, the grilled bread done properly...mmmm.  I am also quite hung over today so that made it even better.  haha! What I didn't understand was the price.  It came to $15 a head with tip...for a burger and fries?   The patty melt was largish, but come on...$15?  I was a little disappointed in that.   Service was good, and even though they were busy our waitress made several drink runs and was attentive. It was an ok experience I thought, but nothing to write home about.  Some day I am going to figure out why restaurantes insist on having a ton of junk on the walls and clapping waiters.  Ugh, I really think that is a major downer and so horribly pretencious and cheesy.

Like other reviewers, I will be the first to admit that I've had better burgers in the region, but I can't say I've had a bad experience at Red Robin. I've been to RR about 5-6 times over a period of a year. I usually get the BBQ Bacon Burger and each time I love it, but I have gotten a few other things on the menu like an avacado burger which was pretty bland and tasteless. I suggest the tower of onion rings for an appetizer. Yeah the service isn't always super, but I've never had a truly bad experience there, and most of the time I go with friends or family who like to chat and don't need things super-fast.  As others have mentioned RR has a "medium" policy on burgers, but usually if you ask for "some pink in the middle" they'll basically cook it medium-rare which is how a burger SHOULD be cooked.  I am pretty sure RR recently raised their prices across the board, so it's not quite as cheap as it used to be which kind of makes it not so worth it, but if you're in the area and want a burger and fries this place is a decent stop.

Just a so-so place. A lot of my friends go nuts over this place and I have no idea why. The burgers are acceptable, but hardly what I'd call "outrageously delicious" as they claim. I think it's kind of funny how instead of "how would you like that cooked", they ask "some or no pink", since the rare to well scale is apparently too complicated. Honestly, I don't like their fries at all. They're dry, bland, and tasteless. Like chewing on sawdust. Their "special seasoning" (aka generic season-all) helps, a bit. Service tends to fit right in with everything else: mediocre. Servers do the bare minimum.  There's a good variety of burger choices. The couple I'd tried were good, but just nothing special. A decent burger with decent toppings. A place I wouldn't object to going with others, but not likely to have returned on my own.  Make sure you ask for "no pink", since a few hours after eating a "some pink" burger for dinner I was up all night vomiting profusely. So now I definitely don't feel the need to go back here.

Seems to be a lot of mixed reviews. I usually take a trip down with friends a few times a year.  Food has always been great for all of us, endless fries, towering onion rings, and great burgers.  Specialty shakes/smoothies are amazing too,  Price is great, never had any problems with wait, never had any problems with service.

Went there with the Grandkids for lunch during school break. Food is typical fast food, burgers are a little bigger but not any better then some other places! I do think it's a good place to go to with kids. Staff was very attentive, fast service, great with the kids, always checking back with us. Been there three times with others but it would not be our first choice if we were dining alone.

I have had quite a different experience at Red Robin than many other reviewers had. I have dined in and done take out several times, and my meals have always been quite good! One problem I do have though is often when we do take out, all of us want out own additional bin of bottomless fries, and often they just give us one to split amongst the many of us that order, they say it will be enough for us all - clearly they dont know the people I work with - they can eat!  Take-out is always ready when promised, which is great since we come from quite a distance to order here. I dined there twice within a month over the summer and had two different waiters and they were both great, one was annoying attentive and never shut up, but my meal was perfection.  My favorite order, getting a bowl of french onion, enjoying some mozzarella sticks, having a freckled lemonade, and the whiskey river bbq burger. I have had the whiskey river, the bacon burger and the 5 alarm chicken sandwich, and I will say they are all very good. If you are going here though, I wouldn't suggest the bacon burger, cause you can get that anyway, the claim to fame here is "gourmet" burgers, so try one of their more innovative recipes. Whiskey River burger is great because it has great bbq sauce and some crisp onion straws to go on it! The 5 alarm comes as a burger or chicken sandwich, I have only had the chicken. But if you like a kick, this is the way to go here. It isn't overwhelming, just gives you a little sweat, but you won't need a bucket of water to cool off your mouth! Freckled lemonade is a must try drink, lemonade with strawberries in it, and its bottomless! Lastly, always ask for a side of campfire sauce - usually it is offered with onion rings, but unless you ask for it, you will not receive - and trust me you want to receive this! Its a mix of mayo with bbq sauce, and its got just the right proportion of each! Have it with your onion rings, mozzies, or fries, and you will love it everytime!

God, I felt bad for recommending this place. I even felt worse that we drove from Albany to Clifton Park to come here. The place was packed on a Sunday afternoon, which we probably should have expected and were fine with waiting fifteen minutes. I had heard that the burgers are excellent and that the amount of choices are incredible. Neither of these statements are completely true.  Upon finding out about the bottomless fries, we were elated at the fact that we'd be able to snack on something without actually purchasing an appetizer. I rarely complain about service in restaurants, but our waiter was pretty bad. He didn't remember our drink orders, took over ten minutes to get our drinks to us, another five to give us our first order of fries, and another ten to take our burger order. There were a few interesting, different burgers and I ended up with the Royal Red Robin Burger. You'd think that a burger topped with bacon, egg, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes and mayo must be pretty amazing. I knew that there would be an issue when I learned that the burgers cannot be cooked any rarer than medium. The burger was extremely sloppy, no rhyme or reason for the way it was put together. As for the meat, it had to be cooked medium, so to me, it was a waste of nine bucks. Tasteless, floppy meat. With egg. Blah...  Just one bland basket of steak-fries (even after asking for another basket) and no drink re-fills later, we were definitely ready to leave. We waited a good twenty minutes for our check while the employee dressed in the robin costumer was about to visit our table twice. The final nail in the coffin? The waiter looked at the amount of cash enclosed with our bill and THEN asked if we needed change.

The best burgers & drinks in Latham New York. The price is reasonable, the workers are friendly and the food is fresh... What more could you ask for?! Stop by & try them out you won't be disappointed...

Red Robin makes good burgers, but everything else about this chain restaurant is thoroughly underwhelming.  Their unlimited steak fries are bland and only mildly improved with a liberal dose of Red Robin seasoning (salt, pepper and a little bit of cayenne pepper.)  Avoid the non-burger parts of the menu. The decor consists of the usual chain kitsch along with televisions every twenty feet so diners don't have to actually talk to each other.  The large open dining room gets loud easily and is overwhelming when the restaurant is full.  The waitstaff are good about refilling your drinks and fries but they have an overly fake cheerfulness that disturbs me. Overall, not my ideal restaurant but at least the burgers were good.

Food is very good, prices are a bit high, service is horrendous.   Well if I were to rate this place on its food alone, I'd say Excellent--for a chain.  But I found the prices to be on the high side for this type of place, ex.: my wife's burger--a simple Swiss-topped blackened burger with nothing else on it--was ten bucks.  Bar drinks seemed high too.  But it was the service that puts this review in the crapper.   Now I know better than to expect much in the way of service when visiting these national pub chains, and my sympathies go out to the managers who have to find good help among the lot of 20 years-olds they are forced to pick from, but the service during this visit was absolutely pitiful.  In fact, I think I can say that it was, to my recollection, the worst service experience I've ever had at one of these joints--and I go to them often.  It's not that our waitress (we'll call her Jackie) was rude or mean, it's that she had no memory retention.  This made for reaaaally slow service and a wicked frustrating visit.  For example, it took probably 15 minutes just to get our drinks.  She even had the gall to come back to the table and take our food order before she had brought us the drink order.  And when the drinks finally arrived, two of them were not what was ordered.  To give you a sense of just how brutal this nearly 90-minute visit was, here's a list of all the things we had to ask Jackie for TWICE: silverware, lemons wedges (which were supposed to be in the drinks of our original drink order), a side of bbq sauce, a beer, and wet naps.  And then to top it all off, I had to practically shove the bill and my credit card under Jackie's nose in order for her to take it for processing.  It felt like we'd never get out of there.     I'm thinking Jackie should pursue a different profession and the managers at Red Robin should re-vamp their hiring and training practices.
Best burgers i've ever had! No lie they really are! If you live in latham go there now!
